Description: Fragment of a polychrome tomb-painting representing Nebamun seated (probably associated with the goose census scene from the same tomb) with remains of five vertical registers of polychrome-painted hieroglyphs.
Curator's comments: Published: PM I Part 2, p. 817; N. Strudwick, Masterpieces of Ancient Egypt, London 2006, pp. 174-5. Full publication: R. Parkinson, The Painted Tomb-Chapel of Nebamun: Masterpieces of Ancient Egyptian Art in the British Museum (London: British Museum Press 2008). A. Middleton and K. Uprichard (ed.), The Nebamun Wall paintings: Conservation, Scientific Analysis and Display at the British Museum (London: Archetype 2008).
Additional IDs: Other BM number: EA173 (original Big Number)
